intro: Alsine rimarum, commonly known as sea sandwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the Atlantic coasts of Europe and North Africa. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in saline environments. It produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are succulent and adapted to retain moisture in arid conditions.
